item.title: 35 Questions to Soul & Career
item.description: Imagine you’re waking up five years from now. Look around. What do you see? What do you hear, smell, feel? Who else is in the room?

item.title: Film Noir
item.description: Dive into the fatalistic world of film noir to find out why "dead men are heavier than broken hearts."

item.title: Super Smash Bros. for Beginners
item.description: Not even two hours later, the playing field had leveled, with newer players creating stiff competition for the more experienced ones.

item.title: U Street Murals Art Walk
item.description: Walk with us through the alleyways of U Street's ongoing cultural legacy.

item.title: 20/20 — Bringing Your Vision to Life
item.description: A vision board does not equal a magical manifestation of your goals — but it is a good way to start thinking about them more concretely.

item.title: Spring Tree Identification
item.description: "Lots of things are expensive. Looking at trees is free."

item.title: The Revolution Will Not Be Whispered
item.description: Amplify your voice and the voices of those around you.

item.title: Meet Your Anacostia River: A Boat Tour
item.description: We're making exciting progress toward a clean, swimmable Anacostia River, but a huge amount of work remains!

item.title: Heighten Your Senses in Nature
item.description: Even steps away from one of D.C.'s busiest roads, nature abounds — if you take the time to look for it.

item.title: Who’s That Dead White Guy on a Horse? A Walking Tour
item.description: A walking tour of downtown D.C.'s statues reveals the history and politics behind these prominent features.
